messages.text: The polyhedral model is separate from implementing cache-level tiling and array packing, which are the optimizations we have to do in a library like Gaius that LoopVectorization isn't doing itself yet. messages.text:
I've hard part of that is dealing with dynamic values like number of iterations.
If it's small, faster on CPU. Big, faster on GPU.
The perfect system might generate code for both, and dispatch on these sizes, and doing that well would involve done complicated cost modelling.

What does MLIR promise on this front?

messages.text: If the XY problem means asking question Y while actually needing info about X, then the PQ problem is the complementary situation when someone answers question Q even though P was asked, because the responder only knows something about Q.

messages.text:
:til:  Rust has a rule that is equivalent to forbidding type-piracy. It calls it the Orphan Rule.
You need to either have defined the trait, or defines the type it applies to.

elements.text:
Rust has a rule that is equivalent to forbidding type-piracy. It calls it the Orphan Rule.
You need to either have defined the trait, or defines the type it applies to.

messages.text: <https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/>
(<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WLkMBMUk48E>)

I just asked my psychiatrist father about what his thoughts are-- he made the most observation:

Psychiatrists and psychologists have identified a facet of cognitive behaviour called *reality-testing*, which is the ability for a human being to "measure the validity of a proposition or idea against a processed understanding of the way that the world works". The key component of *diagnose-able delusion* in my father's field is *loss of reality-testing*, which describes the state of an individual who holds a delusion which is intractable against evidence to the contrary or logical argument.

I told my dad about modelling conspiracy theory as "viral thought" and leveraging the established mathematics in epidemiology. I also mentioned that I was a little unsure of the perfectness of the parallel because epidemiological models strongly implicitly depend upon the presence of an "immune system". In response he noted that reality-testing constitutes a sort of immune system in this analogy-- a fantastic contribution! A person's innate ability to resist an infectious thought (a delusion) is at least significantly comprised of their ability to rationalize against it.

We may approximately model those who are susceptible to infection by viral thought or conspiracy as "immuno-compromised" individuals in an epidemiological network.

loss of reality-testing

I told my dad about modelling conspiracy theory as "viral thought" and leveraging the established mathematics in epidemiology. In response he noted that reality-testing constitutes a sort of immune system in this analogy-- a fantastic contribution! We may approximately model those who are susceptible to infection by viral thought or conspiracy as "immuno-compromised" individuals in an epidemiological network.

messages.text: It isn't a coup until it is, and then it is too late. What is apparent is the the Congress of the United States has been suspended and the election of the next President of the United States has been interrupted. Troops are about to show up. Control of the United States will depend what orders those troops follow.

messages.text: NSFW but very on point - written in november. <https://medium.com/indica/i-lived-through-a-coup-america-is-having-one-now-437934b1dac3|https://medium.com/indica/i-lived-through-a-coup-america-is-having-one-now-437934b1dac3>

root.text: I don't see how the current ruler of a country denying the legitimacy of an established process for replacing him and finding every means possible to direct his party to keep him in power is not a coup.  It's not a *competent* coup, but sure, it's a coup.  It's the clown fiesta coup :laughing:

elements.text: I don't see how the current ruler of a country denying the legitimacy of an established process for replacing him and finding every means possible to direct his party to keep him in power is not a coup.  It's not a
competent
coup, but sure, it's a coup.  It's the clown fiesta coup

messages.text: Hey, has anyone much experience Windows Sub-system Linux? What is it like working with the system? I am coming from Fedora Linux to Windows where I use CLI tools like `pandoc`, `neovim`, `rclone` , etc. Would I be at home with WSL? Thanks!

pandoc
neovim
rclone
, etc. Would I be at home with WSL? Thanks!

messages.text: <https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/06/us/politics/russia-cyber-hack.html|https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/06/us/politics/russia-cyber-hack.html>

attachments.title: Widely Used Software Company May Be Entry Point for Huge U.S. Hacking
attachments.author_name: By Nicole Perlroth, David E. Sanger and Julian E. Barnes
attachments.text: Russian hackers may have piggybacked on a tool developed by JetBrains, which is based in the Czech Republic, to gain access to federal government and private sector systems in the United States.
attachments.fallback: The New York Times Widely Used Software Company May Be Entry Point for Huge U.S. Hacking

elements.text: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/06/us/politics/russia-cyber-hack.html
